message: but having that feature will be good and it will save time of users
@chronologik I agree with large listings, but for small code snips that would just be nicer to look at
What happens when you post code now? Does print("Hello Code") work? Sorry, just wanted to check that ;)

Personally I don't think that the simplicity of convore is really meant for posting chunks of code. If you need to post a chunk of code large enough to need indentation to make sense, why not just post something like a pastebin link?

It just removes all spaces/tabs from the beginning of a line:
on open these_items
    repeat with i from 1 to the count of these_items
        set this_item to (item i of these_items)
        set the item_info to info for this_item
    end repeat
Convore guys! there are and will be plenty of developers, who will use convore as their primary discussion area, There must be some way so the tons of coders can share codes in future!
may be gist/pastebin would do it for now (as they do it for irc)
a [pre] or [code] type section would be nice

.function testing
.        for i in w
.            do anything
.        done
.end function
so it removes all double spaces everywhere atm
